newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Details of EU's Canadian wheat tender not yet set.
newsitem.headline: Details of EU's Canadian wheat tender not yet set.

text.p: The European Union has not yet set a date for fixing the details of a tender to import 300,000 tonnes of high quality wheat at zero tariff, such as the split between durum and soft wheat, and the number and timing of tranches, a European Commission official said.
But the EU had changed the rules for tendering for the wheat, expected to come from Canada, in a bid to prevent speculative trading, the official said.
The changes, which concern Regulation 1854/94, were agreed at a weekly meeting of the EU cereals management committee on Thursday.
They included higher deposits payable by traders, longer validity of bids and an obligation to specify the end-user.

Greater flexibility was introduced by allowing traders to make multiple bids instead of only a single bid, the official said. Penalties were lowered for failure to meet quality standards or to import the grain.
The new rules take effect on publication in the EU Official Journal in about three weeks time.
The zero tariff quota was agreed under a 1992 GATT oilseeds panel ruling to compensate Canadian exporters for trade losses due to EU farm subsidies.
